programme.title: Awarapan
programme.desc: Directed by Mohit Suri, Awarapan stars Emraan Hashmi as a tormented hitman working for a crime lord. When he's assigned to monitor his boss's mistress, he begins to question his life choices, leading to a path of self-discovery and redemption. The film is an uncredited remake of the South Korean movie A Bittersweet Life.

programme.title: Suraj Pe Mangal Bhari
programme.desc: Suraj, an eligible bachelor, finds himself getting rejected by the families of many potential brides. Soon, he learns that a wedding detective named Madhu Mangal Rane is the reason.

programme.title: Kalyug
programme.desc: Directed by Mohit Suri, Kalyug stars Kunal Khemu in his debut adult role. The film follows his character's descent into the pornographic underworld after a personal tragedy. As he seeks revenge, he uncovers the industry's seedy operations, leading to a gripping narrative about morality and redemption.

programme.desc: Suraj, an eligible bachelor, finds himself getting rejected by the families of many potential brides. Soon, he learns that a wedding detective named Madhu Mangal Rane is the reason.

programme.title: Kismat Konnection
programme.desc: Directed by Aziz Mirza, this romantic comedy stars Shahid Kapoor as Raj Malhotra, an unsuccessful architect whose luck turns around after meeting Priya (Vidya Balan). As he starts attributing his success to her, complications arise, leading to a tale of love, destiny, and self-discovery.

programme.title: Ek Aur Ek Gyarah
programme.desc: Directed by David Dhawan, this action-comedy features Govinda and Sanjay Dutt as conmen Tara and Sitara. Their escapades lead them to a military household, where they masquerade as patriots, resulting in a series of comedic events. The film combines slapstick humor with action-packed sequences.
